intro: Platylobium reflexum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed everlasting pea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to cream in color. The plant has slender, wiry stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a perennial herb that thrives in dry, sunny environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
